noun.description: In plural (usually in form Pedipalpi). Members of an arachnid order Pedipalpi, including the whip scorpions and similar forms with large pedipalps (now usually separated into distinct orders). Now rare.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in William Sharp MacLeay (1792–1865), entomologist. From pedi- + palpus or its etymon post-classical Latin palpus.
